title: This may sound weird...but have Kalista and Azir already reached a point where they need reworks?
body:
I think we can still consider Kalista and Azir pretty early for there lifetime in league,Azir was late season 4 and I'm pretty sure Kalista
 was early-mid Season 5

But both seem to have hit what seems to be rock bottom,Kalista at a wonderful 46% win rate and Azir with his 41%

The problem?Both of these champions have multiple areas to nerf,but the overall way there kits are designed leaves little room for buffs,Like how much of an unbalanced mess Kalista's passive is or how intoxicating it is to fight an Azir,who bullies you early game,is good mid game,and rips your team apart late game

Kalista has only received 1 buff in her lifetime(I'm quite sure) which was during the marksmen update,while Azir's absurd kit has only received buffs in forms of QOL and bug fixes

so it begs the question

replies.body:
Yes, they do, and everyone except salty chickenmains is aware of that, including some Rioters.

There was a post not so long ago by I think RiotGypsy, who said Azir needs to either get his ranges halved, and be reworked into a battle mage oriented on sick movements with his Shurima Shuffle, or be pushed into long-range hypercarry, but with his mobility halved (Shurima Shuffle removed).

Down-voted for stating facts, life is tough, mate. Take my upvote.

That being said, what would be the proper course of action for Kalista, in your opinion? The root of her problems is her hop mechanism, but it's also at least half her identity. Can Riot manage to keep something similar but less problematic, as they managed to do with Ryze, keeping this machine-gun aspect without the insane burst and the perma-root that were creating problems?

TBH a lot of Kalista's overall power is actually in her ult. Having hard engage on an ADC is something that's almost completely nonexistent for the rest of the lineup (the only exception is Ashe), and combining that utility with the strong raw mobility that her passive gives makes her pretty insane overall. I think that the rest of her kit can be worked around so that the hop mechanic can still stay. 

Just my two cents.

Yeah, her synergy with her support in general, and her ult specifically is the other half of her identity.

To be honest, if I had to choose between the ult and the hop, I'd prefer the keep the ult. It's original, thematically fitting, whereas the hop is just basic orb walking on steroid, and is pretty frustrating to play against.

I could explain in details why pairing with someone and forcefully displacing them is thematically fitting for a Spirit of Vengeance that forces you to give them your soul. But instead, I'll ask: why are the hops more thematically fitting?

They're not, other than to try to simulate a spirit by making her difficult to hit. It's the mechanic in her kit that is least core to her thematic identity; Q and E are direct extensions of her spears, W and R are her Oathsworn mechanics, passive is... some weird mobility thing.

Personally, I'd like to see Kalista's range hit, even below Sivir to say 475, and bringing her damage back to old level or somewhere near it. With that hit she should be able to still hop-kite, but she wouldn't be permanently untouchable.

It's kind of extreme though, and would make her probably heavily abused in lane, but I'd like to at least see it on PBE.

I actually quite like the idea. People don't seem to realize how big ranges differences can be for adcs/auto attackers. The reason Vayne isn't extremely op is because her range forces her to get in close, but she has the kiting mechanism to deal with it. Sounds like Kalista could use the same.

this might actually be really good for kalista because if her damage were higher it would reward her for high skill lane plays (stacking E on a creep and Qing it onto a champion, for instance), and her Q is already a longer range ability to help her CS and deal damage from a safe range.

Really Kalista's kit would be fine with a range nerf as long as the damage was brought up to par, imo. Post 6 she'd still be able to all-in the enemy, it would just make her laning appropriately difficult for how much power she would bring with her lategame damage. She could be the late-game hyper-mobile ADC she was meant to be without dominating her lane because of it...

Maybe her ad ratio could scale with her ult level. It's already .9- maybe make it scale from .7-.9 with ult level. Or .8 to 1.0 if that's too much. Or reward her for stacking her e.... Make her autos do less damage and her e do more.
she needs buffs tho not more nerfs

Keep in mind that they test the most extreme things internally and weed them out before even sending them to the PBE. Maybe they already tried that and it didn't work at all, for all we know, 475 would be the shortest range for all ADC except Graves.

Still, I like your idea.
Well, she is the most mobile ADC by far, and even one of the few to possess hard cc abilities. If she is to keep damage output on their level, she needs to be hit somewhere.

Her hard cc is extremely situational, shrehas to be close to her support, her support has to be alive, and fate's call is in a fairly long cooldown and Essence Reaver would largely be useless on her even if she did have normally scaling autos. Meanwhile, Ashe, Vayne and Draven.

You're horrifyingly wrong, and the main reason that Kalista was Pick/ Ban was brcause of her team utility and not her hops. It's no coincidence that she largely disappeared from competetive play ever since her most recent patch that effectively halved her Soul Mark Damage, made the active largely useless nectar of uptime vs downtime and her ulti cast range and made her base stats dependent on her support.

I would have to agree with you. Kalista's utility is main reason she is chosen as an adc. Being able to engage whenever you want is very strong. 

Also, I think people overlook how strong the sentinels are/were. A good kalista lane is hard to gank when they put multiple sentinels scouting enemy bushes and river.

I may very well be wrong, I'm definitely not an ADC expert. But I do play Support a fair bit, and from what I could see, the big mastery point between high and low ELO Kalistas was how well they were able to hop, not how well they were able to use her kit's utility. And generally, this kind of high discrepancy between high and low ELOs is what makes a champ hard to balance/in need of a rework.

So I don't know for sure, your argument sounds right, but I'm still not 100% convinced.

Posting a second time to reply to this real quick.  While you are mostly correct it does tie into his lore and the tower passive originally was supposed to go with his concept of slowly sieging the enemy base by using W on towers, knocking them down, then putting up your tower to push to the next one.

Without the W tower bombs I'm not so sure it makes sense anymore, but it was part of the original concept.  His towers are also a great deal weaker than regular towers and the passive has a long cooldown, on top of which it's a niche use ability that requires a dead tower + time to set it up + enemies within range willing to stay close to it.

So, I'm ok with the tower passive.  I miss the CDR to attack speed passive though.

No, you are completely right. Kalista was a product of an overloaded kit (She should have really been split into two champions, one who focuses on low damage auto attacks with an activated ability for burst, and another one that focuses on the black oath passives.), while Azir needs to either be a hypermobile battle mage, or an extra long siege mage, he can't be both.

I've said the passive on her W, as well as a few other bonuses for her and her Soulbound (think Zeke's Herald) need to replace Martial Poise.
With that done, Q should receive a version of Martial Poise that ONLY applies to Q to let her retain some mobility and kiting, except then it would be bound to a cooldown and Mana cost.
People keep arguing that Martial Poise is the unique, defining characteristic of her and her kit, and this I disagree with. From a lore and a gameplay standpoint, the teamwork of her and her Soulbound is her most defining feature and should be played up more; Martial Poise was was just tacked on for no reason and doesn't really fit her thematically, so I would be quite happy if it got scrapped.
PASSIVE: Kalista can only active Martial Poise when she casts Q or when her oathsworn is near her.
I was thinking of moving martial poise to an ability. Something like kog's w. Give her clear Windows of weakness and strength.

Her complete reliance on another champion is her problem. She is an ADC and is already going to have a support, making her stronger for it is the issue.
